thread.title: Indian Premier League 2017: Happy for myself and Rashid Khan, says Mohammad Nabi after SRH bag Afghan players : Cricket, News - India Today
thread.title_full: Indian Premier League 2017: Happy for myself and Rashid Khan, says Mohammad Nabi after SRH bag Afghan players : Cricket, News - India Today

title: Indian Premier League 2017: Happy for myself and Rashid Khan, says Mohammad Nabi after SRH bag Afghan players : Cricket, News - India Today
text:
Mohammad Nabi (Reuters Photo) 
Afghanistan cricketers on Monday attracted major bids at the Indian Premier League 2017 auction in Bengaluru. 
Mohammad Nabi became the first Afghanistan player to be bought in an IPL auction. He was sold to defending champions Sunrisers Hyderabad (SRH) for Rs 30 lakh. Nabi's teammate Rashid Khan fetched Rs 4 crore from SRH. 
Nabi, who is ranked world No.4 in the ICC's all-rounders list for T20 Internationals, was ecstatic after making a major breakthrough. 
In T20Is, off-spinner Nabi has so far pocketed 56 wickets at a decent economy rate of 6.96. 
Nabi soon took to Twitter to express his "happiness" and he even praised teenager Rashid for joining the cash-rich T20 league. FLOODED WITH HAPPINESS TODAY NOT ONLY FOR MYSELF BUT RATHER FOR OUR JUNIOR ROCKING PLAYER #RASHIDARMAN BEING SELECTED FOR @SunRisers . @IPL â€” Mohammad Nabi (@MohammadNabi007) 20 February 2017 
The 18-year-old Rashid has played 21 T20 Internationals already and has snared 31 wickets. The leggie has an impressive economy rate of 6.14 which shows that he is extremely difficult to get away. David Warner, his skipper at SRH, should be thrilled with these two latest acquisitions.
